text: ==Canadian Football News in 1926== The British Columbia Rugby Football Union was formed on September 1. ==Regular season== ===Final regular season standings=== Note: GP = Games Played, W = Wins, L = Losses, T = Ties, PF = Points For, PA = Points Against, Pts = Points {| cellspacing="10" | valign="top" | {| class="wikitable" |+ Interprovincial Rugby Football Unionhttps://news.google.com/newspapers?id=DsUuAAAAIBAJ&sjid;=o9kFAAAAIBAJ&pg;=2848%2C4857607 Ottawa Citizen - November 15, 1926 ! Team 2 |- |November 8 || Winnipeg St.John's 14 || Winnipeg Vcitorias 5 |} |} *Winnipeg St.John's advance to western semi-final ===CIRFU Semi-Final=== {| cellspacing="10" | valign="top" | {| class="wikitable" ! Date !! Away !! Home |- |November 20 || Varsity Blues 12 || McGill Redmen 2 |} |} *Varsity advances to the ICRFU Final.https://news.google.com/newspapers?id=FMUuAAAAIBAJ&sjid;=o9kFAAAAIBAJ&pg;=7014%2C5677185 Ottawa Citizen - November 22, 1926 ===CIRFU Final=== {| cellspacing="10" | valign="top" | {| class="wikitable" ! Date !! Away !! Home |- |November 27 || Queen's Golden Gaels 0 || Varsity Blues 8 |} |} *Varsity advances to the Grey Cup.https://news.google.com/newspapers?id=T44uAAAAIBAJ&sjid;=94sFAAAAIBAJ&pg;=6458%2C3990707 Montreal Gazette - November 29, 1926 ===East Final=== {| cellspacing="10" | valign="top" | {| class="wikitable" ! Date !! Away !! Home |- |November 20 || Ottawa Senators 7 || Toronto Balmy Beach Beachers 6 |} |} *Ottawa advances to the Grey Cup game.https://news.google.com/newspapers?id=SY4uAAAAIBAJ&sjid;=94sFAAAAIBAJ&pg;=6545%2C2982691 The Montreal Gazette - November 22, 1926 ==Grey Cup Championship== {| cellspacing="10" | valign="top" | {| class="wikitable" ! bgcolor="#DDDDDD" colspan="4" |December 4 14th Annual Grey Cup Game: Varsity Stadium - Toronto, Ontario |- || Ottawa Senators 10 || Toronto Varsity Blues 7 |- | align="center" colspan="4" | The Ottawa Senators are the 1926 Grey Cup Champions |- |} |} This was the final time a university team made it to the Grey Cup final. Clubs in the Intercollegiate Rugby Football Union continued to play for the title until 1937, but could not make it past the eastern playoffs. ==References== Category:Canadian Football League seasons
title: 1926 in Canadian football
